intro: Sida diploscypha, commonly known as the narrowleaf mallows, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico, where it thrives in dry, sandy soils. The plant features small, pinkish to white flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, with a distinctive shape that aids in identification. Sida diploscypha is typically found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
